{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3746].
  {panel}

I have the use case that we use one server instance for JIRA Service Desk and have several other instances in our organization. Now there is the great feature to create linked issues - unfortunately just on the same server. I would love to choose from the servers as well. 

Also when a linked issue is translated then, a notification is given as a comment (if set so). But this does not work with linked issues from another server.

I guess there would be a huge interest in this new feature.

Cheers,
Christoph

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3742].
  {panel}

h3. Summary:
When creating a new custom report in JSD using the time metrics Breached and Met, the report shows a graphic based on the number of tickets but if you use the export csv feature, the exported file will display a time value (probably the SLA) that is 00:00 instead of the number of tickets.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Select Reports on the left menu in a Service Desk Project.
# Under Custom, select New Report.
# Provide a name to the New Report.
# Select Add Series > Select in Series the option Breached > Provide a name in label > Select Add.
# Select Add Series > Select in Series the option Met > Provide a name in label > Select Add.
# Select Create.
# Select Export CSV.

h3. Expected Result:
The exported file should show a integer value related to the number of tickets.

h3. Actual Result:
The exported file shows a time value that is 00:00.
fields.summary: Export CSV feature broken when using in JSD Custom Time Metric Reports.

h3. Summary
The customer has raised an issue that when there are 4 service desk projects created, one portal name on the help center (under *popular* section) is not aligned to other portal names.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create 4 service desk projects

The 4 portal names should be listed under *popular* section divided in three columns and aligned to each other

h3. Actual Results
 !2016-05-04_16-24-36_SDS-14664.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
The css file (batch.css) who controls this layout is generated dynamically. No workaround for the moment.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3733].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

If the current assignee of a JIRA Service Desk issue does not have Assignable permissions, Customers cannot be added to the Participants field through the Customer Portal.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a request in a SD
# Assign it to a user, use "agent"
# Go to user and roles and remove "agent" as a service desk team member
# Try to add any user as a request participant

h3. Expected Results

* Request participant added.
* Assignee field should fail on its own and not blow up another field.

h3. Actual Results

The error "Failed to update participants field, errors: " occurs and the field is not updated as per the attached screenshot.

h3. Workaround

Provide the assignee with the correct permissions. They may need to be unassigned / reassigned the issue for this to work.

h3. Notes

This issue should be reproducible by making any other field fail to update while trying to add request participants, the steps above are just the way it was discovered in a support case.
This issue is also reproducible if the user trying to add the Request Participant doesn't have other permissions, like "Modify Reporter"
fields.summary: Request Participants not addable, failing with empty error message due to other field validations

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3728].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if Email Request is enabled in a Service Desk project, issue creation, and issue update will be from email and Customer Portal. There is no flexibility in terms of restricting Customers to create issue via Customer Portal (do not let Customers create issue via email) but Customers will be able to update the issue via email.

h3. Suggested Solution
Instead of having just one option to enable or disable Email Request, perhaps JIRA Service Desk can have another option to allow Customers to only update issues via email.
fields.summary: Flexibility in JIRA Service Desk Mail Handler

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3726].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When I click on the button the create a Knowledge Base article in Confluence from Jira Service Desk, I get the attached "page not found". The applications show connected successfully, but I have not found a way past this error. Main requirement is that SD user does not exist in Confluence.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create application link With Confluence instance (make sure to tick option that same users exist in both instances)
# Create a new user in Jira/SD that does not exist in Confluence.
# Create Service Desk project with that new user. Space will be automatically created in Confluence.
# Create one service desk issue and from it create Knowledge base.

h3. Expected Results
# Page will not be created (lack of permissions on Confluence for this user) and link will be visible in Service Desk issue. 

h3. Actual Results
- If you use default name for the new page it will create a link on the Service Desk issue that leads to that page.
- Page will be redirected to this:
 !KB Issue.JPG|thumbnail! 
- And the page will exist only in Confluence DB.
- If you used different name for page, link will not be visible but page will exist in Confluence DB.
 
h3. Notes
To delete broken link and page, follow this [KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-remove-a-page-manually-in-the-database-using-sql-commands-385321460.html] 


h3.Workaround
- In SD, Project settings > Knowledge base, click  Don't link to a Confluence space (this will delete link).
- Then click Link to a Confluence space
- Link to new or old Confluence space
- Permissions will be fixed and user that does not have permissions on Confluence side will get error message that he does not have permissions for creating KB in Confluence.
fields.summary: Page Not found when updating Knowledge Base from Service Desk

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When the Reporter is changed in JIRA Service Desk, the Reporter does not receive a notification even though the Notification scheme is configured to send a notification to the Reporter when the issue is updated. The Assignee and watchers receive the notification that the Reporter was changed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue through the customer's portal
# Changed the Reporter to another user or customer

h3. Expected Results
The user shall receive a notification that he has been set as the Reporter on an issue.

h3. Actual Results
Notification is set to Assignee and current watchers but not the Reporter.

h4. Workaround
There is no current known workaround for this behavior
fields.summary: No notification sent to the Reporter when set on Jira Service Desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3718].
  {panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 10 December 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#deebff}Hi everyone,

Thank you for your interest in this issue.

As a part of [Jira Service Management Data Center 4.21|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagement/jira-service-management-4-21-x-release-notes-1096102630.html#JiraServiceManagement4.21.xreleasenotes-requests] we have released column configuration on the Help center’s request list view. This allows Jira admins to select the columns that they would like to appear in their customer's requests list. It also allows customers to configure and order the columns.

The available fields are type, reference, summary, status, service project, requester, created date, updated date, due date, assignee and priority.

Please refer to our documentation to [learn how to configure the requests list|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagementserver/configuring-request-view-1095250690.html].

Kind regards,

Charlie Marriott
Jira Service Management, Data Center & Server
{panel}
h3. Problem Description

There are only 3 drop-down boxes in _Help Center Request_ at the moment and it's not possible to customize it. As a user, I would like the ability to customize it so that I can add additional drop-down selection (i.e _"created date", "status" and "number of days issue is open_).
- !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide the ability to customize it so that it's easier to search for specific request.
fields.summary: Ability to customize customer Help Center Request

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3716].
  {panel}

Hello,

At this time, users that are Customers (as in, they do not consume a user license but can open issues) cannot view issues that they haven't reporter or haven't been added as watcher. This is a limitation of the customer portal. In order for users to be able to view issues, they would need to have a JIRA license. 

For my case, I would like be able to grant some of the customers the ability to search for issues through either the main interface (navigator), through the portal or something completely different. 

A lot of times, organizations have different categories: For us, we have internal customers who require to search for tickets, but not work on them (such as closing, transitioning, commenting etc). Our external customers are absolutely fine with having only access to tickets they own.
fields.summary: Include the ability to allow certain customers to browse projects/issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3714].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When searching in Customer Portal, modifying/deleting a previous keyword does not auto populate search results. 

h3. Environment
* Issue occurs in Firefox, Safari and Chrome, though the replication steps are slightly different. The issue is most obvious in Chrome. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JSD project
# Link a Confluence space to the project in project settings and make sure customers can access space/project.
# Visit the customer portal page to your project and type in a search word. Notice that as you type, there is a spinning circle to indicate that the system is searching.
# Once the search results auto populate, backspace to delete the word.
# Begin typing in a new search word. If the search auto populates, complete steps 3-5 again, until you find that nothing populates or happens when you type in search words. 

h3. Expected Results
When typing in a search word in the customer portal, articles should auto populate or a message saying “No solutions found.” should appear (if nothing matches the search). The below screenshot shows an example of a search for a keyword that does not exist in the KB:
!search_expected.png|thumbnail!
If I delete the word *MacBook*, and try typing in a new search term, the portal should begin to auto populate responses to my new search term. 
 
h3. Actual Results
The first search works, however if you delete and try typing in a new word, nothing will populate. An example of this can be seen in the following screenshot:
!search_actual.png|thumbnail!

Depending upon which browser you’re using, you may need to delete and re-add keywords multiple times to replicate. In Chrome it happens typically after one time. In Safari and Firefox it can take up to 4 or 5 times of typing in a keyword, deleting, and adding a new word. 
Nothing is apparent in the logs, aside from the following:
{noformat}
2016-04-26 20:05:36.501498500 2016-04-26 20:05:36,501 JIRA-EventThread-271 WARN rfuerst 1205x12718x1 1ekp03u 4.15.43.214 /servicedesk/customer/portal/2 [c.a.workcontext.api.WorkContextManager] Created WorkContext leniently (see: go/work-context-lenient-mode-errors) thread: JIRA-EventThread-271
2016-04-26 20:05:37.419404500 2016-04-26 20:05:37,419 JIRA-EventThread-273 WARN rfuerst 1205x12718x1 1ekp03u 4.15.43.214 /servicedesk/customer/portal/2 [c.a.workcontext.api.WorkContextManager] Created WorkContext leniently (see: go/work-context-lenient-mode-errors) thread
{noformat}

Development console does not show anything either:
!dev_console.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
The current workaround is to completely reload the customer portal page and re-initiate a search.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3709].
  {panel}

h2. Problem statement
Service Desk currently allows Agents to create requests on behalf of customers.
These issues are treated as if they have been created by the customer, and generate a notification that indicates this. This can create confusion on what the source of an issue has been, as there currently is no way for a customer to see the difference between issues created by them, or on their behalf. Only Agents are capable to see the difference, for which they have to check the History tab of the issue in JIRA (not Service Desk)

h2. Suggestion
Whenever an agent creates an issue on behalf of another user, send out a notification that reflects this, instead of using the current create request notification. This way, a customer can see the difference between issues created by themself, and those created on their behalf.
fields.summary: Send a separate notification when an Agent creates an issue on behalf of a customer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3708].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently it is possible to create two different mail handlers for JIRA SD
# *JIRA Service Desk Project Administration > Email requests* (hereby refered to as _SD mail handler_)
# *JIRA Administration > System > Incoming Mail* and assign to a Service Desk project (hereby refered to as _non-SD mail handler_)

This causes problem/confusion to many JIRA Administrators during troubleshooting because some are not aware of this change or its implication since JIRA 7: [Why do users need application access to create issues in JIRA 7?|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/31663613/why-do-users-need-application-access-to-create-issues-in-jira-7]

Some JIRA Administrators will attempt to create a _non-SD mail handler_ for the SD project in *JIRA Administration > System > Incoming Mail* and discover that the mail handler fails to generate the issue from their customer's email. This is due to the reasons explained in the link above (SD customers do not have application access). They are not aware that only the _SD mail handler_ will allow the creation of issues from the email of users without application access.

h3. Suggested Solution
# Prevent a _non-SD mail handler_ from being assigned to a Service Desk project
# When JIRA Administrators clicks on "Add Incoming Mail Handler" in *JIRA Administration > System > Incoming Mail*, display a list of projects.Depending on the selected project, (SD or non-SD project) create the appropriate mail handler
# Alternatively, force the creation of Service Desk mail handler in *JIRA Service Desk Project Administration > Email requests* only, but display it as read-only in *JIRA Administration > System > Incoming Mail*

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk and JIRA Core/Software Mail Handler needs to be separated/clearly defined

fields.description:
h3. Summary

An *Issue created* automation rule is not triggering when a *Issue matches* conditional is in place, where the conditional is "Request participants" = *some_user*.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.1.4
* JSD 3.1.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Configure an Automation Rule with the following example parameters:

{noformat}WHEN: Issue created
IF: Issue matches: "Request participants" = some_user
THEN: Add comment: Automation successful{noformat}

2. Send an email into the Service Desk mail handler, with *some_user* in either the *To:* or *Cc:* fields to ensure that *some_user* is a Request Participant

h3. Expected Results

1. An issue is created in the Service Desk project where *some_user* is a Request Participant.
2. The automation rule has triggered; in this case, "Automation successful" is added as a comment.

h3. Actual Results
1. An issue is created in the Service Desk project where *some_user* is a Request Participant.
2. The automation rule is not triggered.
 
h3.Workaround
No workaround known at this time. Must proceed manually rather than using Automation for this trigger.
fields.summary: Service Desk Automation does not trigger "Issue created" rule on condition "Issue matches" for "Request Participant" through email channel

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3695].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Missing options when configuring JIRA Service Desk Knowledge Base integration with Confluence.

It affects JIRA 7.1.1 and Confluence 5.8.14 integration.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA 7.1.1 with Service Desk 3.1.1
# Install Confluence 5.8.14
# Create an application link between JIRA and Confluence with oAuth 2L and user impersonation enabled.
# Link a Confluence Space with a Service Desk project knowledge base in JIRA.

h3. Expected Results
To be able to view the missing configuration options (in red) as per screenshot below: 

 !missing option.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
A message asking to upgrade Confluence is displayed instead showing the configuration options.

 !missing option2.png|thumbnail! 

We also get the following entry logged in JIRA log:

{noformat}
2016-04-21 15:51:18,033 http-nio-8880-exec-16 WARN admin 951x1199x1 1xk1vv 192.168.10.122 /rest/servicedesk/1/knowledgebase/permissions/TEST [c.a.s.internal.applink.BaseAppLinkResponseHandlerImpl] Confluence KB plugin present but the endpoint is not. Check that the Confluence Knowledge Base plugin is at least version 2.0.5.
{noformat}

h3. Notes
This was working properly on JIRA Service Desk 2.5 with Confluence 5.8.14 and there is nothing on the online documentation [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESKSERVER031/Serving+customers+with+a+knowledge+base] to address the version incompatibility.

h3. Workaround

Upgrade Confluence to version 5.9.x
fields.summary: Missing options when configuring JIRA Service Desk Knowledge Base integration with Confluence.

h3. Summary
If you add a group or user to JIRA's Default project roles "Administrator", then this does not reflect on SD projects. However, if you add to another role like *Service Desk Team*, then this reflects in the Project Specific role.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to {{Administration Menu>System>Project Roles}}
# Add a user/group to *Service Desk Team* Role

# Go back to {{Administration Menu>System>Project Roles}}
# Add a user/group to *Administrator* Role
# Go back to the Service Desk Project
# Go the the projects Administration page and open *Users and roles*

h3. Expected Results
Under *ADMINISTRATORS* you should see the added user/group

h3. Actual Results
The user/group is not added.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Issue Create event triggers unwanted notification to reporter of the ticket

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Remove all the people (users) under issue create event in notifications.
# Create a ticket 

h3. Expected Result 

Since there is no one included under Issue Create event no one should receive notification 

h3. Actual Result

Notification will be received by reporter of the ticket

h4. *Customer usecase which leads to second (unwanted) notification*

1) Add a custom "Notification" event to your JIRA instance
2) Create vanilla Service Desk project e.g. IT Service Desk
3) Edit notification scheme:
- remove ALL notifications from Issue Created event
- add notification to some hardcoded user or group, use Issue Created notification template
4) Create "Initial Delay" SLA in Service Desk, start from Create Issue, stops on Assignee being set, set goal to 5min (or less) for all issues
5) Edit workflow, since we are using vanilla JSD project - edit the transition from "Waiting to Support" to "Waiting for Customer" (this is not the real intent, purely for test purpose):
- in the postfunctions replace triggering Generic Event with the custom "Notification" event
6) Create automation rule, to be triggered on "Initial Delay" SLA being breached, for all issues, transition from "Waiting for Support" to "Waiting for Customer"
7) Submit a request, use request type associated with issue type that uses the workflow you've modified

Expected:
- request is created, "falls" into "Waiting for Support"
- the standard "we confirm that we got your request" notification goes out to the EndUser
- nobody on the internal team picks it up for 5 minutes
- automation transitions it to "Waiting for Customer"
- notification goes out to the internal team

Observed:
- request is created, "falls" into "Waiting for Support"
- the standard "we confirm that we got your request" notification goes out to the EndUser
- nobody on the internal team picks it up for 5 minutes
- automation transitions it to "Waiting for Customer"
- notification goes out to the internal team
- an additional unwanted identical "we confirm that we got your request" notification goes out to the EndUser
fields.summary: Issue Create Event Triggers Notification Regardless of Settings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3682].
  {panel}

Basically for SLA events there's a "timed promise" added into a table in the database that tells Service Desk at what point in the future it should fire. The issue is that we're calculating that future value incorrectly, so although the SLA is working fine, automation events that should be triggered when the SLA event happens aren't.

If you change the issue that does not affect the SLA start/pause/stop AFTER the SLA has started, it will reset the target time for the automation when handler to the full SLA goal time (minus the 60 minutes, as the first event is fired 60 min before breach)
and for issues that drag on and drag on (i.e. lots of updates) it never will.

The following query can be used for find out about SLA's time promise for future

{code:sql}
SELECT
    t."ID",
    (p.pkey || '-' ||  i.issuenum) AS issue,
    t."CLASSIFICATION",
    t."STATUS",
    TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE 'epoch' + (t."CREATED_TIME_MILLIS"/1000) * INTERVAL '1 second' AS created_time,
    TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE 'epoch' + (t."UPDATED_TIME_MILLIS"/1000) * INTERVAL '1 second' AS updated_time,
    TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE 'epoch' + (t."TARGET_TIME_MILLIS"/1000)  * INTERVAL '1 second' AS target_time
FROM
    "AO_F1B27B_KEY_COMPONENT" c
LEFT JOIN
    "AO_F1B27B_PROMISE" t ON t."ID" = c."TIMED_PROMISE_ID"
LEFT JOIN
    jiraissue i ON i.id = c."VALUE"::int
LEFT JOIN
    project p ON p.id = i.project
ORDER BY t."ID" ASC;
{code}

*How to reproduce*
- Create any SLA
- Create an issue
- Keep updating that issue and see SLA's time promise "target_time" updated incorrectly
fields.summary: SLA's time promise is not scheduled correctly after updating

h3. Summary
Customers cannot be mentioned by an Agent. Only users in Service Desk Team (other than those in Service Desk Customer) can be mentioned. When a customer is in *Service Desk Customers*, then you are not able to mention him. However, they can be mentioned if they are also added to the *Service Desk Team*.

# As an agent, internal try to mention him in *that* created ticket. You will not be able to.
# Add the customer now to *Service Desk Team*
# Go back to that ticket, and try to mention the customer in that ticket

h3. Expected Results
You should not be able to mention the customer

h3. Actual Results
You are able to mention the customer

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3669].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In certain cases, Service Desks need to be restricted to a set of customers belonging to one and the same organisation.
Public signup does not provide a proper means to prevent incorrect customer accounts not belonging to that organisation from being created.

The only alternative available right now, is to disable public signup, which has as a result that the Service Desk administrator can get presented with significant amounts of work solely for account creation.

h3. Suggested Solution
As such, being able to define an email domain as requirement for public signup, can provide a small degree of safety, while at the same time prevent a lot of overhead for the administrators.

For instance, if a Service Desk has public signup enabled, and an email domain has been defined, the Service Desk will only allow account creation if the source address conforms to the defined domain.
fields.summary: Allow email domain restrictions for public signup

The Help Center currently does not display Service Desk portal branding and descriptions.
When adding a logo and a description to a Service Desk portal, these get displayed properly on the Service Desk portal itself.
However, the Help Center will only display the available Service Desks with their names as a hyperlink to the portal.
It appears that in pre Service Desk 3.x versions, both the log and description added to a Service Desk portal were taken over into the Help Center, providing a more descriptive look & feel to the Help Center.
Can this get (re)implemented for JIRA Service Desk?

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3656].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

System is not allowing send an invitation for customers to the portal that have a single character between dots on their email address.

For example:
joel.e.ramos@gmail.com
diego.t.oliveira@gmail.com

Note that the letter ‘e’ is between two dots. We have tested many emails and the system does not allow it.

h3. Environment

JIRA - 7.2.0-OD-05-030

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk Project
# Go to the ‘Customers’
# Click on ‘Invite customers’
# Type on email like: joel.e.ramos@gmail.com
# Click ‘Send invites’

# Step 2

h3. Expected Results

The system should send the invitation.

h3. Actual Results
This is the log error:

{code}
2016-04-12 14:08:35.013432500 Apr 12, 2016 2:08:35 PM com.sun.jersey.spi.container.servlet.WebComponent filterFormParameters
2016-04-12 14:08:35.013433500 WARNING: A servlet request, to the URI https://manentia.atlassian.net/rest/servicedesk/1/customer/pages/portal/26/user/login, contains form parameters in the request body but the request body has been consumed by the servlet or a servlet filter accessing the request parameters. Only resource methods using @FormParam will work as expected. Resource methods consuming the request body by other means will not work as expected.
{code}

This is the error message: *email* is not a valid email address.

# Add him later to the Service Desk Customers on the ‘Users and Roles’ of the project.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After configuring [Receiving request by email|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESKSERVER031/Receiving+requests+by+email] , performing the test in {{Application > Email Request}} returns 'No problems found with email settings configuration.Successfully connected to the specified email server.', however, when click on 'View Log' , nothing is showing in connectivity log tab and processing log tab.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

This can happen if any abrupt interruption occurs towards the database/JIRA itself.
 * network issue towards DB
 * Database server is restarted.
 * Database server is upgraded.

h3. Expected Results

Emails are able to be retrieved by JSD
 Scheduled Service should be clever enough to perform a retry
h3. Actual Results

Emails are not able to be retrieved
 Scheduled Service are stuck
h3. Notes

Looking at the [Scheduled Jobs|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/troubleshooting-jira-service-desk-incoming-mail-790960076.html#TroubleshootingJIRAServiceDeskIncomingMail-ScheduledJobs], the scheduled jobs seems to hangs and is not running (by referring to 'Next Run' date, compare with the real time of the server. The next run date/time will be backdated)
 !Selection_267.png|thumbnail!

A Number of Root Cause investigation based on the error:
 Fixing below issue can help to solve the issue as well (as a workaround)
{code:java}
Caused by: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:SELECT ID, JOB_ID, JOB_RUNNER_KEY, SCHED_TYPE, INTERVAL_MILLIS, FIRST_RUN, CRON_EXPRESSION, TIME_ZONE, NEXT_RUN, VERSION, PARAMETERS FROM public.clusteredjob WHERE JOB_ID=? (FATAL: terminating connection due to administrator command)

{code}
{code:java}
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: Unable to establish a connection with the database. (IO Error: The Network Adapter could not establish the connection)

{code}
 * This is due to DB is restarted/lost connection temporarily and JIRA was not restart together afterwards

{code:java}
Caused by: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: Unable to establish a connection with the database. (Unknown server host name 'xxx.yyy.corp.com'.)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SQLProcessor.getConnection(SQLProcessor.java:399)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SQLProcessor.prepareStatement(SQLProcessor.java:543)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.createEntityListIterator(GenericDAO.java:960)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.selectListIteratorByCondition(GenericDAO.java:883)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericHelperDAO.findListIteratorByCondition(GenericHelperDAO.java:194)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.findListIteratorByCondition(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:398)

{code}
 * There are DNS/routing/network issue from JIRA to Database

h3. Workaround

*Restart JIRA*
fields.summary: Jira Service Desk stops processing email following any connectivity issues between the instance and database

Hi,

When a user is creating an issue through the portal and we have validations in "Create Issue" transition, if one of the validations fails, the issue will not be created as expected, but the user is always shown an unspecific message, unlike when the issue is being created through JIRA's conventional UI. In this last case the issue will be shown the custom message provided by the failing validator.

Example: Validation in "Create Issue" transition to ensure at least 5 characters in issue description:

I'm using [boolean validator|https://bitbucket.org/fcarmario/jira-workflow-toolbox/wiki/condition-validator/Boolean%20Condition%20and%20Validator] of [JIRA Workflow Toolbox plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.fca.jira.plugins.workflowToolbox.workflow-toolbox/server/overview]:

 !validation-configuration.png|thumbnail!

+Creating Issue at JIRA GUI:+
 !message-jira-gui.png|thumbnail! 

+Creating Issue at JSD Portal:+
  !message-portal.png|thumbnail! 

I think that the custom message provided by validators should be included in the message shown to portal users, even if you include additional information like administrator's contact link, which are not included when issue is created through JIRA's conventional GUI.

I have created this issue as a bug because proposals do not allow to attach files.

Thank you,

Fidel
fields.summary: Unspecific message shown in Portal when a validation in "Create Issue" transition fails

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

*Trigger:* The reporter of an issue replies to the Satisfaction Survey email.
*Causes:* The satisfaction survey is included as a comment to the issue, together with the score links and token.
*Result:* Anyone with access to the issue can set the customer's satisfaction score by copy-pasting the desired URL.

The trigger will only work if the reporter's email account is set to include the previous email in the reply.

*Suggested fix:* Filter the email replies included as comments to erase the links matching the structure of a satisfaction link.

*Notes*
Forwarding the notification mail that includes the survey request to another user can also cause that other user to follow the score links, effectively overwriting the previous value.

!reply.jpg!
fields.summary: Satisfaction survey added as a comment lets anyone set the score

fields.description:
h4. Description
Service Desk Customers cannot view Knowledge Base articles directly through portal when Confluence space/page permissions does not allow anonymous view.

h4. Steps to Replicate

Set up a JIRA Service Desk Knowledge Base integration with Confluence as per the document below:
- [Providing self-help resources for your customers with a knowledge base|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/Providing+self-help+resources+for+your+customers+with+a+knowledge+base]

# Install the latest JIRA with Service Desk and Confluence.
# Configure an Application Link with 2-Legged OAuth Authentication (2LOA) between the applications.
# Create a Service Desk and link it to a Confluence Space.
# Create a KB article on the Confluence space.
# Log out of both applications and access the customer portal.
# After performing a search, the relevant KB articles titles are displayed, however clicking on the desired article will open a pop-up asking for the user to log into Confluence to browse the KB Article directly on Confluence.

h4. Expected behavior
The login prompt should not appear or *at least* not redirect the user to browse Confluence, which is an undesirable behavior and defeats the purpose of having setup the application link through JIRA SD. 

h4. Affected Customers
This issue occurs only for Customers who have a shared user base between Service Desk and Confluence which does NOT have SSO setup.
fields.summary: Prompt to login into Confluence when trying to visualize Knowledge Base Articles

h3. Problem Definition

In our setup of JSD: the reported issues have both a reporter (the customer usually), and one or several participants (the customers customers). And we use the comments feature to send information to each other in order to clarify/find out what to do.
Since you could add participants and remove participants along the way, it´s difficult to see in the GUI to whom the notifications has been sent to or not. So in some cases it ends up with (our customer usually) adding a new comment, and @:ing all participants again just to be sure.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a notification information to the comment itself and / or a notification menu. As this will somewhat demystify the notifications sent.
Example shown as below:
 !2016-04-06 new_picture.png|thumbnail!

h3. Summary
When the mail puller encounters an message in the mail channel mailbox originating from an invalid formatted "From" field, the mail puller will not be able to process that message, and continuously loop on this message, effectively rendering the mail pulling process broken. A correctly formatted looks like "name@domain.extension".
A known source for this issue is Microsoft Outlook 365, where certain messages originate from "Microsoft Outlook" opposed to a valid email address in the "From" field.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Ensure the mailbox configured as mail channel in a Service Desk project contains an email originating from a source which does not provide a valid formatted email address in the "From" field as described in the summary
# Have the mail puller pull and process the email automatically

h3. Expected Results
The mail gets pulled into the database.
In this case, it is not relevant for the email to get processed further beyond this point.
Once the email has been pulled, the mail puller should continue to pull mails from the mail box.

h3. Actual Results
The mail puller gets stuck on the incorrect email and will continuously loop on it, instead of moving on to the next mail in the mailbox.
The atlassian-jira-incoming-mail.log file will display the following error for each attempt to pull the mail in question:
{code}
Unable to create issue with message.
javax.mail.internet.AddressException: Local address contains control or whitespace in string ``Microsoft Outlook''
{code} 

h3. Notes
The relevant message in Microsoft Outlook is an automatically generated one to inform the user of certain changes on the mail platform, or the welcoming message when starting to use the product for the first time. So far, no other mail providers are known to cause similar issues.

h3.Workaround
Delete the offending message from the mail box. This will allow the mail puller to proceed from that point onwards.
fields.summary: Emails from an invalid formatted "From" address will stop the mail puller

h3. Workaround

Change the SLA calendar to use the GMT offset correspondent to the current timezone after DST correction. For example, in NY use GMT-4.

However, since it's not possible to access any SLA configuration panel upon the occurrence of this problem, you can use the below query to update this option on JIRA's database. Replace {{America/New York}} and {{Etc/GMT+4}} accordingly.

(i) _Since Java uses POSIX-style timezones, the '+n' stands for n hours before GMT, whereas '-n' stands for n hours ahead of GMT._
{code:sql}
UPDATE "AO_7A2604_CALENDAR" SET "TIMEZONE" = 'Etc/GMT+4' WHERE "TIMEZONE" = "America/New York"
{code}
fields.summary: Working Hours plug-in doesn't handle DST gaps properly

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

When we try to log in we get the below page.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3617].
  {panel}

The articles from https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/serving-customers-with-a-knowledge-base-732528995.html is misleading users , and there are not sufficient guide/steps on configuring this. As this will need further configuration on Confluence side to ensure that the functionality "Allow all active service desk users and customers" to works properly. This has lead to creation of bug ticket created in JAC due to the confusion that occurs:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-3448

 !Selection_117.png|thumbnail! 
*_If you choose to restrict viewing of the linked Confluence space to licensed users, you must grant customers a Confluence license or open your Confluence space to anonymous access._*

Which I have broken down to below:

If you choose to restrict viewing of the linked Confluence space to licensed users, you must grant customers a Confluence license (this is correct)
If you choose to restrict viewing of the linked Confluence space to licensed users, you must open your Confluence space to anonymous access ( this is not correct, why would you want to open Confluence space to anonymous access if you would like to restrict it?)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3615].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
If an attachment gets added to a customer request, which has an identical name to another attachment under the same request, all existing references to the original attachment will get adjusted to reflect the new attachment.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As a customer, add an attachment to a request. From the customer view, this issue will have a linked url displayed as {{<baseurl>/servicedesk/customershim/secure/attachment/<attachmentID1>/<attachmentID1>_<attachmentname>}}
# As an Agent, add an attachment to the same request, and choose "Add to issue only". The file name should be identical to the file as attached under step 1. This attachment is not visible from the customer view

h3. Expected Results
The attachment added by the customer should remain being displayed as {{<baseurl>/servicedesk/customershim/secure/attachment/<attachmentID1>/<attachmentID1>_<attachmentname>}} and be accessible as such.

h3. Actual Results
The url referencing the attachment in the customer view has changed to {{<baseurl>/servicedesk/customershim/secure/attachment/<attachmentID2>/<attachmentID2>_<attachmentname>}}

h3. Notes
For the above setup, the files do not have to be identical, just the file name needs to be identical. This has been tested with both identical files, as well as with different files renamed to have identical names.
fields.summary: Adding an attachment with an identical file name will change all existing references in a request

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3614].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
If an Agent adds an attachment to a customer request, and chooses "Add to issue only" instead of "Share with the customer", the attachment in question will not be visible to the customer.
However, the customer *is* capable of downloading the file if it has the direct url to the attachment.
For instance, a direct url to an attachment is as follows:
{code}
<baseurl>/servicedesk/customershim/secure/attachment/10102/10102_<attachmentname>
{code}

Changing the {{/10102/}} segment to any other ID allows for the customer to download the attachment matching that ID. The last segment of the url is not relevant, so it is not required to know the exact file name in order to download the file.

(!) This only works for attachments which are placed under an issue to which the customer in question has access. Attachments located under issues to which the customer does not have access, can *not* be downloaded by the customer. However, it *is* possible for the customer to download files which have been hidden using the attaching method as described above. Whether or not these attachments should be accessible for the customer is currently not certain.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a request as a customer
# Add an attachment to the request as customer
# Add an attachment to the request as Agent, and choose "Add to issue only"
# As customer, copy the link to the attachment added it added, and increase the ID by 1

h3. Expected Results
Since the attachment added by the Agent is not visible from the customer view, it should not be accessible for the customer

h3. Actual Results
After inserting the adjusted url, the customer gets prompted with a download dialogue.

h3. Notes
Attachment ID increase by 1 each time one gets added to the instance. The above reproduction steps only work when between the customer and the agent adding an attachment, no other attachments have been added which are not accessible by the customer.
fields.summary: Internal attachments can be downloaded by customers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3612].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When accessing a customer portal (e.g. https://instance/servicedesk/customer/portal/1), on the top left corner of the page you have the help center icon displayed. Clicking on that icon sends you to the help center page (e.g. https://instance/servicedesk/customer/portals). 

Customers having only one service desk project (therefore only one customer portal) should have the possibility to change the help center icon link url to the only customer portal available.


\\
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow customers to customize the link url for the icon displayed at the top right corner or, in case only one customer portal is available, change the link url to the one of the only customer portal available.
fields.summary: It should be possible to change the help center icon link to point to a specific customer portal in JIRA Service Desk

fields.description:
h5. Description
When using the Service Desk comment templates, if the customer's display name has an apostrophe, the name is displayed with encoding.

Example:  *Hi Test U'ser,* displays as {{Hi Test U'ser,}}

We have tested with several other characters and they all display not-encoded, as it should:
* ü (u-umlat)
* - (hyphen)
* * (asterisk)
* _ (underscore)

Additionally, if we type a apostrophe/single quote into the comment box, it shows not-encoded.
If we try to edit the comment, the apostrophe in the name is encoded again.

h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Create an user with an apostrophe on the name (e.g. *JIRA's Administrator*)
# Try to add a comment on the issue and see the encoded character on the comment field.
fields.summary: Pre-populated texts display issue when user's name has an apostrophe

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3609].
  {panel}

We are trying use cloud JIRA for a public bug tracker and also for support Service Desk.
We have enabled public sign-up for both JIRA and the portal.

If a user signs up to the portal first, it is impossible for them to sign-up for JIRA.  They need to go through the admin to get them to configure it.

If the user signs up to JIRA first, there is no issue as they will have access to the support portal.

As a result, I can't send new users to the portal first. I need to send them to JIRA to create an account and the direct them to the portal.
fields.summary: Self sign-up in Service Desk stops being able to self sign-up for JIRA Core/Software
